title: Exercise Northstar: After Action
description: The exercise is over. Command wants a data-driven report analysing unit readiness, decision speed, and logistics efficiency. Your analysis will shape how the SAF trains for the next 5 years.

software-engineer.title: Build the Review Tool
software-engineer.instruction: The generals want an interactive tool that lets them replay the entire exercise — scrolling through a timeline like a video player to see how decisions played out with data on screen. How do you build it?
software-engineer.hint: Think about the trade-off between giving commanders something rich and interactive versus something simpler that can be shared widely and is ready sooner.

options.label: Build a full replay tool with the actual map, unit movements, and decision markers. Takes 2 weeks but commanders can rewatch the entire exercise with data annotations.
Generate a report with charts, key-moment screenshots, and auto-generated insights. Done in 3 days and easy to share as a document. But no interactive replay.
Use AI to automatically find the 20 most critical moments and generate a short analysis for each. Novel approach but the AI might miss events that don't look dramatic in the data.
Build a shared tool where unit commanders can mark up the timeline with their own observations. Richer insights from multiple people but takes time to collect everyone's input.

data-scientist.title: Calculate Unit Readiness Scores
data-scientist.instruction: You have mountains of exercise data: GPS tracks, supply requests, radio logs, decision timestamps. The generals want a single readiness score for each unit. Put the analysis steps in the right order to produce credible results.
data-scientist.hint: Clean your data first, then agree on what you're measuring, then compute — never jump straight to calculating scores from messy raw data.

items.label: Clean the raw data by removing sensor errors and duplicate entries
Agree with the exercise planners on what 'readiness' actually means and how to measure it
Calculate a readiness score for each unit using the agreed definition
Compare the scores against what human observers reported to catch any mistakes
Show the results to command with charts and an honest note on how confident you are in the numbers

cloud-engineer.title: Work Out How Much Storage You Need
cloud-engineer.instruction: The exercise data needs to be archived for future training analysis. Based on how much data was generated each day (in terabytes) over the last 4 days of the exercise, estimate the total storage (in terabytes) needed to archive the full 14-day exercise — including an extra 30% for file indexes and metadata.
cloud-engineer.hint: Add up the daily data, calculate the average, multiply by 14 days, then add 30% on top for overhead.
